item.description: Triangles in Surgery # 1. Hesselbach’s Triangle # Borders: Medial: Rectus sheath Superolateral: Inferior epigastric artery Inferior: Inguinal ligament Importance: Helps in differentiating direct from indirect hernias. 2. Bryant’s Triangle # Formation: Patient lies supine Line 1: From the anterior superior iliac spine vertically down to the bed Line 2: From the tip of the greater trochanter to join Line 1 at right angles Line 3: From the anterior superior iliac spine to the tip of the greater trochanter Importance: Diminution in the length of Line 2 indicates upward displacement of the greater trochanter.

item.title: Demo
